greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of n-step prudent self-avoiding walks on honeycomb lattice.
comment: A prudent walk never takes a step pointing towards a vertex it has already visited.  Prudent walks are self-avoiding but not reversible in general.
reference: M. Bousquet-Mélou, Families of prudent self-avoiding walks, DMTCS proc. AJ, 2008, 167-180.
E. Duchi, On some classes of prudent walks, in: FPSAC'05, Taormina, Italy, 2005.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..110
example: This 8-step prudent self-avoiding walk on honeycomb lattice from (S) to (E) is not reversible:
maple: b:= proc(n, x, y, z, u, v, w) option remember;
`if`(n=0, 1, `if`(x>y, b(n, y, x, w, v, u, z),
mathematica: a /@ Range[0, 34] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 22 2019, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 11 2011
